TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant served in ORG ( ORG ) and in DATE retired from service . His military pension was assessed according to his rank and DATE of service and was paid from ORG . The payments terminated in DATE , following the dissolution of GPE .

However , on DATE , ORG , ORG ( ORG fond mirovinskog i invalidskog osigurnaja radnika PERSON , Područna služba u GPE ) , assessed the applicant ’s pension , as from DATE , to CARDINAL,CARDINAL % of the amount he had received in DATE .

After the ensuing applicant ’s appeal was dismissed , he instituted proceedings with ORG ( Upravni sud PERSON ) . The applicant claimed that the decisions to decrease his military pension were unlawful and discriminatory and impaired his property rights .

ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim on DATE . It found that the lower bodies applied the provisions of the laws regulating pension rights of the former ORG officers correctly . They based their decision on the LAW of DATE which provided that the former ORG pensions were to be assessed to PERCENT of what they received in DATE . Furthermore , the applicant ’s property rights were not impaired by the NORP authorities as ORG stopped paying the applicant ’s pension . The NORP authorities accepted the payment of his pension according to the relevant provisions of the Acts regulating that matter . The applicant failed to lodge a constitutional complaint against ORG decision .
Instead , the applicant challenged the constitutionality of the laws enacted in DATE and DATE regulating pension rights of the former ORG officers .

On DATE ORG terminated those proceedings as on DATE ORG had passed a new law concerning that matter - the Former LAW ( Zakon o ostvarivanju prava iz mirovnskog i invalidskog osiguranja pripadnika bivše ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

In the meantime , on DATE the applicant lodged another constitutional claim challenging the constitutionality of the above CARDINAL Act . He complained that the DATE Act impaired his property rights in that it provided that his military pension be reduced and in that it discriminated against him in so far as pensions of other categories of citizens were not reduced .
On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) terminated the proceedings concerning the applicant ’s claim as on DATE new legislation was again enacted regulating pension rights of all NORP citizens .
The relevant provisions of the DATE LAW on ORG ( hereinafter the “ DATE LAW ” - Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) read as follows :
“ Every person has a right to institute proceedings challenging the constitutionality of the laws ... ”
“ Each person whose rights have been violated by a decision based on the legislation declared unconstitutional or unlawful may ask the body that took the decision to vary it ... ”

“ The Constitutional Court shall terminate proceedings concerning the constitutionality of legislation that has been repealed or brought into line with the LAW and statute law while those proceedings are pending before ORG . ”

“ Every person , who considers that any of his constitutional rights have been violated by a decision of judicial or administrative body or any other body invested with public authority , may lodge a constitutional complaint with ORG . ”
“ By a decision accepting a constitutional complaint the Constitutional Court quashes the contested decision and remits a case for re - trial . ”
